required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparing Known Modes of Ventilation Delivered by Trilogy Versus Conventional Mechanical Ventilators

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study (Part II) will be to compare the performance of the Trilogy device and a conventional ventilator (participant's current device). Both devices will be set to the participants' current mode and prescription settings.

detailed_description.textblock:
A. Primary Hypothesis and end-point In patients with respiratory insufficiency, when compared to conventional ventilators, the Trilogy device achieves comparable level of gas exchange (measured as partial pressure of CO2 in arterial or venous blood)and SpO2 levels during various modes of ventilation.
B. Secondary Hypothesis and end-points In patients with respiratory insufficiency, when compared to conventional ventilators, the Trilogy device achieves comparable breathing pattern (tidal volume, respiratory rate, minute ventilation), hemodynamics (heart rate), and subjective measures of breathing comfort (measured by modified Borg dyspnea scale).

primary_outcome.measure: Comparable Level of Gas Exchange (Measured as Partial Pressure of CO2 in Arterial or Venous Blood).
primary_outcome.time_frame: After one hour of ventilator use
primary_outcome.description: Blood gas was obtained for this study one hour after use of each device.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparable Level of Gas Exchange SpO2 Levels During Various Modes of Ventilation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: After one hour of ventilator use
primary_outcome.description: Pulse Oximetry was measured after one hour of use of each ventilator.

secondary_outcome.description: Tidal volume is the amount of air that moves in or out of the lungs with each respiratory cycle. It measures around 500 mL in an average healthy adult male and approximately 400 mL in a healthy female. Average tidal volume was compare after a hour of use of each device.
Minute ventilation is the volume of gas inhaled or exhaled from a person's lungs per minute. This was measured after one hour of use of each device.
Number of beats per minute. Measured after one hour of use of each device.

intervention.description: Exposure for one hour on the Trilogy ventilator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age > 21 years of age; < 85 years of age
2. Able to follow instructions
3. Able to provide informed consent
4. Considered clinically stable, with low flow oxygen requirements less than 15 LPM (or FIO2 less than 60 %) and PEEP no greater than 10 cm H2O.
5. Requiring mechanical ventilation through nasal/facial mask,tracheostomy or endotracheal tube (ET Tube)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Clinically unstable, i.e.,
1. Acute Respiratory Failure
2. Participants with refractory hypotension defined as systolic blood pressure less than 90 mm Hg despite inotropic agents),
3. Uncontrolled cardiac ischemia or arrhythmias,
4. or as otherwise determined inappropriate for the study as determined by the investigator.
2. Patients suffering from metastatic or terminal cancer and patients with do-not-resuscitate orders
3. Pregnancy

group.title: Trilogy First, Then Standard of Care
group.description: These participants used Trilogy first, then Standard of Care.

group.title: Standard of Care First, Then Trilogy
group.description: these participants used Standard of Care first, then Trilogy.

outcome.population: Only 10 out of 11 total participants' data were used for blood gases due to one participant's venous line occluding.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
